short_summary: LL491 Scotch Bonnet Island Tower Replacement
description: Engineering services to replace an Automated Tonne Light (ATON) structure at LL491 Scotch Bonnet Island to allow access to necessary Sandy and Marginal areas (SMIN) equipment. This project will be completed within 6 months from the project start date with the majority of the efforts remote
full_summary:
### LL491 Scotch Bonnet Island Tower Replacement
#### Solicitation Reference Number
**PW-23-01025124**

The Government of Canada, as represented by Fisheries and Oceans Canada, invites qualified contractors to bid on the LL491 Scotch Bonnet Island Tower Replacement project.

#### Project Overview

The project involves the replacement of an existing Automated Tidal Observation Network (ATON) tower at the Scotch Bonnet Island site. The new tower will ensure safe access and maintenance of Ship Radio Automated Network (SRAN) equipment. The existing lighthouse station is of historical significance and will be preserved in its current state.

#### Scope of Work

The contractor will be responsible for the removal of the existing ATON and the construction of a new tower in the same location. The new tower has been fabricated by a third party and will be provided to the contractor.

#### Project Timeline

*   Contract duration: March 22, 2023, to June 30, 2023
*   Delivery timeframe: March 22, 2023, to June 30, 2023

#### Tender Submission Requirements

*   Bids must be submitted electronically via the Canadabuyseeds Canada website.
*   The online tender documentation, including the Request for Proposal, Responsive Schedule, and Technical Specifications, can be found on the website.

#### Trade Agreements

This project is open to bidders participating in the following trade agreements:

*   World Trade Organization Agreement on Government Procurement (WTO GPA)
*   Canada-Panama Free Trade Agreement
*   Canada-UK Trade Continuity Agreement (Canada-UK TCA)
*   Canada-Peru Free Trade Agreement (CPFTA)
*   Canada-Chile Free Trade Agreement (CCFTA)

#### Contact Information

For inquiries or clarification on the project, please contact Fisheries and Oceans Canada at:
